thread.title: Davis Square Donuts and Bagels Will, In Fact, Open in Somerville
thread.title_full: Davis Square Donuts and Bagels Will, In Fact, Open in Somerville

author: Dana Hatic
title: Davis Square Donuts and Bagels Will, In Fact, Open in Somerville
text: Davis Square Donuts and Bagels Will, In Fact, Open in Somerville There’s a new owner involved Davis Square Donuts and Bagels Rachel Leah Blumenthal for Eater Davis Square’s doughnut and bagel saga continues: A shop previously planned for Summer Street will in fact come to pass, despite a brief wrench in the plan. Davis Square Donuts and Bagels is slated to open at 377 Summer St., and new owner George Dardonis says it could make its debut sometime in April or May. The original plan came from restaurateur Kyriakos Kouzoukas, who operates Opa Greek Yeeros around the corner from the space that will house Davis Square Donuts and Bagels. Kouzoukas pulled out of the bagel project last summer , speculating that the landlord would re-lease the space, which was previously used for non-food retail. Dardonis told Eater that he reached an agreement with the landlord at 377 Summer St. and will move forward with the concept, which could open in the next couple months. Davis Square Donuts and Bagels has a working website but no details yet about specific menu items.
